page.title: 03KIRKBURTON TRAINING CENTRE
page.content: The children join the centre at the age of 16 after leaving school. One part of the centre is a special needs centre. This is where the oldest pupils in the centre go because their brains are not as active as the younger ones. In there they practise changing their clothes, making cups of tea and threading needles to steady their hands. Outside they have started gardening. They have two greenhouses, one plastic tunnel and one brick plot for pot plants. They grow vegetables and house plants. There is also a laundry where a girl does the washing for the centre. There are two washing machines and one drier. In sewing they make aprons, mats and learn how to use a sewing machine. In pottery they make ornaments, spiral mugs and piggybanks. One boy can use the potters wheel.
